title: Ingleside (Iron Station, North Carolina)
text:
Ingleside is a historic <a href="Plantation%20house%20in%20the%20Southern%20United%20States">house</a> located near <a href="Iron%20Station%2C%20North%20Carolina">Iron Station</a>, <a href="Lincoln%20County%2C%20North%20Carolina">Lincoln County, North Carolina</a>. It was built about 1817, and is a two-story, five bay by three bay, <a href="Federal%20architecture">Federal</a> style brick mansion. The front facade features a pedimented portico supported by four <a href="Ionic%20order">Ionic order</a> <a href="stucco">stucco</a>ed brick columns. It was built by Congressman <a href="Daniel%20Munroe%20Forney">Daniel Munroe Forney</a>, son of Congressman <a href="Peter%20Forney">Peter Forney</a>.
It was listed on the <a href="National%20Register%20of%20Historic%20Places">National Register of Historic Places</a> in 1972.
